content:
We created a new stream in our self-hosted zulip. We have around 200 users, and all of those need to be added to that new stream. We know we can set default memberships for new users, but:
How can we bulk-add all our existing users to that new stream?
@mouk we've added a feature for doing that conveniently in the Zulip 4.0 branch; the easiest solution is to upgrade to master (what we run on this server and zulip.com) to get the new feature.
Hi @Tim Abbott ! Thanks for the reply! Any idea when a 4.0 will be released..?
@mouk likely in something like a month; but we generally recommend just upgrading to master if you want new features not in the latest release -- our master branch is generally quite stable.

@Tim Abbott Yep, I read that elsewhere too. :-) I'm just a bit worried because I also read that reverting out of a major (3.x -> 4.x) upgrade can be more difficult, because of database upgrades... So in case master turns out to be problematic for us, the upgrade could have been a one-way street...
@mouk that's correct, but I don't think we've ever had anyone actually want to downgrade to a previous release.

So, I've upgraded to master. The fuctionality to add multiple users is worded like: "Use #streamname to subscribe a whole stream", right? That is the function? It's confusing me. Do I add all users that are currently subscribed to #streamname, or does it 'link' the two channels? (as in: subscribe the #streamname itself)

Perhaps a better wording would be something like: "Use #streamname to add all subscribers from #streamname" or so...? (or am I the only one finding it confusing, or misunderstanding the functionality?)
@mouk you're correct, it just copies subscribers -- we should definitely fix the string to be more clear.
